Name: unifi-protect-backup
Overview: A Python based tool for backing up UniFi Protect event clips as they occur to cloud storage.

TimeZone.Name: TimeZone
TimeZone.Description: TimeZone for the container refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones for a list of possible timezones

UniFi Protect username.Name: UniFi Protect username
UniFi Protect username.Description: Username to login to Unifi Protect instance

Verify SSL certificate.Name: Verify SSL certificate
Verify SSL certificate.Description: Set to false if your UniFi protect instances doesn't have a valid SSL certificate

Clip retention period.Name: Clip retention period
Clip retention period.Description: How long should event clips be backed up for. Format as per the `--max-age` argument of `rclone` (https://rclone.org/filtering/#max-age-don-t-transfer-any-file-older-than-this)

rclone destination.Name: rclone destination
rclone destination.Description: `rclone` destination path in the format {rclone remote}:{path on remote}. E.g.`gdrive:/backups/unifi_protect`

Ignore Cameras.Name: Ignore Cameras
Ignore Cameras.Description: IDs of the cameras you want unifi-protect-backup to ignore. A list of camera IDs will be appear at the start of the log

rclone args.Name: rclone args
rclone args.Description: Optional arguments which are directly passed to `rclone rcat`. See the `rclone` documentation for the full set of arguments it supports (https://rclone.org/docs/)

Clip directory.Name: Clip directory
Clip directory.Description: ONLY USED WITH LOCAL RCLONE REMOTE
